item.description: It’s this simple, folks: stop all illegal immigration. Deport all illegal aliens here now. Enact Voter ID laws. That will solve every problem America has. We will reduce taxes, stop crime, fraud, Democrat DEI scams, inflation, homelessness, and the housing crisis.

item.title: @elonmusk: Turning off payments and forcing verification before taxpayer money flows out the door is one of the...
item.description: Turning off payments and forcing verification before taxpayer money flows out the door is one of the most important steps we can take to end the fraud in Minnesota. But there will be many more to come. Great job to@HHS_Jimand@SecKennedy.

item.title: @elonmusk: This is the harrowing reality of what detransitioners face, says@ChloeCole: “The moment that I detra...
item.description: This is the harrowing reality of what detransitioners face, says@ChloeCole: “The moment that I detransitioned, I was human garbage to them. I was subhuman even. … They told me: ‘This is all your fault. Don't put this on us. You were the one who said yes, you were the one who wanted this. You were a complete idiot for not knowing that you weren't truly transgender. So don't come crying to us. And you should shut up about this because you might scare somebody out of getting the care that they really need. And you are a waste of resources. You are a waste of the love and support of your family. You didn't deserve the support of your doctors. You didn't deserve any of this. So stay quiet and stop being a problem.’ …There were people who were trying to compel me to retransition, people who were trying to tell me to kill myself, even just for the fact that I was going against the dogma. And I stayed low for a little bit. I apologized to the same people who were abusing me because I was a freshly traumatized 16 year old girl. I had been bullied in school before, but nobody had ever treated me this horribly over such a painful part of my life. But after a while of being painfully isolated. I started to really think the way that they are treating me is not deserved. I'm speaking to nothing but my experience, to the way that I feel and to reality. I'm going to speak up, regardless of whether they want me to or not. And I just knew that there had to be other detransitioners out there. And very quickly, I learned that they were in the thousands. And I'm sure that it's doubled, tripled, quadrupled over the years, the amount of us who are out there. We are never going to know the real numbers. …And some of the harassment, the hatred I faced over the years has gotten worse. I've been doxxed. I have had people assaulting me, chasing after me in government buildings, who have tried to hurt me, who have wished death upon me.”

item.title: @elonmusk: BREAKING: South Korea Hits Record Low Fertility in 2025 – Demographic Crisis Deepens to Historic Wor...
item.description: BREAKING: South Korea Hits Record Low Fertility in 2025 – Demographic Crisis Deepens to Historic Worst! South Korea’s Total Fertility Rate (TFR) has plummeted over 70 years, but 2025 marks the worst year yet, with preliminary data showing a continued decline amid the world’s most acute population crisis. Key Historical TFR Trends: • 1950s–1960: ~6.0–6.3 (post-war peak) • 1970: 4.2 • 1980: 2.8 • 1990s: 1.6–1.8 • 2000s: ~1.2 • 2020: 0.84 • 2023: 0.72 (previous record low) • 2024: Slight rebound to ~0.75 • 2025: Ongoing decline in projections, hitting a new historic nadir despite monthly birth fluctuations From over 6 children per woman in the 1950s to below 0.8 today, this is one of the sharpest global drops – warning of population halving by 2100 if unchecked. Persistent challenges make 2025 the bleakest in South Korea’s fertility history.

item.title: @elonmusk: Grok Imagine prompt: monochromatic black and white image in a cyberpunk anime art style, blending fu...
item.description: Grok Imagine prompt: monochromatic black and white image in a cyberpunk anime art style, blending futuristic and mechanical character elements, with an intricately detailed character design inspired by Shiguroi Suijima, featuring a female cyborg character with a serious expression, her face partially covered by a sleek, reflective visor with faint, glowing crimson circuitry, shown as a close-up portrait focusing on her upper body and face, with a subtle, high-contrast chiaroscuro lighting effect highlighting her angular features, framed in a dynamic diagonal composition that enhances her futuristic aura
